distribution: The natural range of this species runs from the River Ouémé drainage in southern Benin to the lower River Cross basin in Nigeria, extending into Cameroon in the east.
habitat: The natural range of this species runs from the River Ouémé drainage in southern Benin to the lower River Cross basin in Nigeria, extending into Cameroon in the east.
maintenance: Loosely planted tank with floating cover and open areas for swimming.
diet: Most meaty foods are readily accepted. Care should be taken not to feed much red meat such as beef heart as these foods can interfere withe the fish’s digestive tract. Prawns, earthworms, mussel etc. are better alternatives.
behaviour: Predatory. Should not be kept with fish it can fit in it’s mouth. Suggested tankmates are other similarly sized predatory fish such as polypterus, datnoides etc. or robust bottom dwellers such as large loricariids and catfish.
reproduction: Little is known about the breeding habits of this species.
